result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell L Wyatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $561.81 to Erik V.  To be paid first, before costs/surcharges.

Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  
Court ordered for every $10.00 the defendant has on his books, $1.00 is to go towards restitution.
Balance would be then paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against the defendant.

*9/15/15 Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell L Wyatt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (11 pages) commencing 9-15-15 PLEA HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Parties have no additions or corrections to the PSI.  The Court wants to see the transcript from the plea hearing before doing the sentencing.  The matter is adjourned for sentencing to May 10, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Darrell L Wyatt not in court, in custody (not produced).  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Due to the Court being in trial and unavailable, matter had to be adjourned.  Matter adjourned to March 10, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for sentencing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Darrell L Wyatt not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  The Court did not receive the PSI.  Another one had to be ordered.  Matter is adjourned to January 29, 2016 at 8:30am for sentencing in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.   Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered Pre-Sentence Investigation.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentence Hearing in Branch 30 on November 19, 2015 at 8:30am.  The Court VACATED the October 12, 2015 Jury Trial date.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.
Telephone call received requesting defendant be produced for 09-15-2015
(2) with attached Restitution Worksheets filed by ADA Joanne Hardtke on behalf of the State.
form WITHOUT Addendum filed by Atty. Kerri Cleghorn on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have not yet reached an agreement.
Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial dates.
Court GRANTS request.

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 09-15-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 10-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Darrell L Wyatt not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 06-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.

Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in custody.  Ron Dague for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Thorne-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ERIK V. AND ELVIRAE R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Darrell L Wyatt in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
